Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.tetris.controller.core.InputHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameActionInvoker, InputCommandRegistrar
public class InputHandler extends Object implements GameActionInvoker, InputCommandRegistrar
Handles keyboard input and maps key presses to game commands. Uses the Command pattern to decouple input handling from game actions.

Key features:

  • Maps keyboard keys to game commands (move, rotate, drop)
  • Supports both gameplay commands and global commands
  • Can invert horizontal controls for special game modes
  • Respects pause and game over states
See Also:
  • GameCommand
  • CommandRegistry
  • GameActionInvoker

  • Constructor Details

    • InputHandler

      public InputHandler(BooleanSupplier isPauseSupplier, BooleanSupplier isGameOverSupplier, CommandRegistry commandRegistry, InputCommandFactory inputCommandFactory)
      Constructs an InputHandler with the specified dependencies.
      Parameters:
      isPauseSupplier - supplier to check if game is paused
      isGameOverSupplier - supplier to check if game is over
      commandRegistry - registry for command bindings
      inputCommandFactory - factory for creating input commands

  • Method Details

    • setInvertHorizontal

      public void setInvertHorizontal(boolean invert)
      Enables or disables horizontal control inversion. When enabled, left becomes right and vice versa.
      Parameters:
      invert - true to invert controls, false for normal

    • setGameController

      public void setGameController(IGameController gameController)
      Sets the game controller for command execution.
      Parameters:
      gameController - the game controller to use

    • handle

      public boolean handle(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Handles a keyboard event and executes the corresponding command.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - the keyboard event to process
      Returns:
      true if the event was handled, false otherwise

      Specified by:
